item.title: Annotation Redundancy
item.description: The 71st Annual Fall Meeting of Korean Society of Pathologists Case presentation at molecular pathology lecture

item.title: Web application for NGS interpretation description management
item.description:
Background
The next generation sequencing (NGS) has been used in cancer treatment and diagnosis. The pathologic report of NGS includes the interpretation of found variants. The interpretation describes the information and the clinical significance of the variants. The list of the interpretation produced in a pathology lab is a kind of a knowledge base. We made a simple web application for management of NGS interpretation description using Shiny which is an R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps.

Methods
We modified the publically opened Shiny CRUD (Create, Read, Update and Delete) application (https://github.com/bborgesr/wsds2017). The existing interpretation data was managed with Microsoft Excel. The excel data was modified and inserted in the SQLite database on the R program. The web application was locally deployed.

Results It takes one weak as additional work to develope the application by one intermediate R user who had no experience or knowladge of the web application development. The pathologists can manage together the interpretation knowledge base. The user interface becomes better. The workflow is improved. The demo site is located at https://jkang.shinyapps.io/Interpretation/.

Conclusions
The pathology lab can develop a web application for NGS interpretation description management using Shiny R package

item.title: Big Data TCGA
item.description:
Abstact

TCGA is a large consortium of comprehensive cancer genomic research that opens publically the data. There are several way to access to the TCGA data. This talk introduce among the simple ways.

item.title: Bayesian
item.description:
Abstract

Introduction of Bayesian approch in base calling and copy number variation (CNV). This is for the intradepartment lecture.
